message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! I think you'll love it. I'm willing to let it go for $12000. What do you think?
I'm interested in the product, but $12000 is a bit steep for me. I was thinking more along the lines of $10000. Can you meet me in the middle at $11000?

I understand you're looking for a good deal, Bob. I can see you're interested in the product, but I need to make a profit. I can meet you at $11000, but I'll need to get a bit more than that. How about $11500?

I appreciate your willingness to meet me at $11500, but I'm still a bit far from my budget. I can offer $11000, and I'm willing to throw in an additional $200 as a one-time payment if you're willing to meet me at this price. Can you consider it?

I appreciate the extra $200 you're offering, Bob, but I think I can do better than that. I'll meet you at $11000, but I'd like to get the $200 as part of the product price, not as a one-time payment. How about we stick with the original price of $11500, and I'll throw in some additional support services that are worth $500?

I appreciate the offer of additional support services, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you at $11000, but I'd like to negotiate the value of the support services separately. Can we discuss the details of the support services and see if we can come to a mutually agreeable price for them?
